bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, May 20, 1900

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, May 20, 1900
div1.p:
I am afraid
it has been a little
over a week since I
wrote to you. I received
your letters of the 8th
and the 11th I was
surprised to hear of
your going so soon.

Our seasons are all
alike here and I had
really forgotten that
summer was coming
on with you. I am
glad you got away in
time to miss the hot spell
Very likely at this time
Atlantic City would
not be affected much
by a hot wave.

Mabel writes that you
are going to take Houston
this summer for awhile.
That is awfully good
of you. He is not
hard to manage however
and sleeps well.

Hatley is a more pleasant
place than Beverly and it
may be hard to get a
good place at Beverly.

On the other hand I would
be glad if you were near
Mabel at that time.

I have been very busy lately finishing
up a piece of work that had to have
be done at a certain time. The
rainy season is on here It
rains nearly every day and there
was one spell of six days of
almost continuous rain.

Mabel sent me a picture of
you and Houston which she took.
I am very glad to have it. It is
very good and I have no picture
of you taken within the last
fifteen years or so.

Remember me kindly to Mrs Morgant
Miller.
